# Cancer Framework

> A Laravel-inspired web framework for Rust with routing, middleware,
> database ORM, sessions, caching, queues, events, notifications,
> broadcasting, storage, and Inertia.js integration.

## AI-Assisted Development (cancer-mcp)

The cancer-mcp crate provides MCP tools for AI agents (like Laravel Boost):

| Tool | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `application_info` | Framework version, environment, installed crates, models |
| `list_routes` | All registered routes with methods, paths, handlers |
| `list_middleware` | Global and route middleware chain |
| `list_migrations` | Database migrations with status |
| `list_jobs` | Background jobs defined in the app |
| `list_events` | Events and their listeners |
| `list_commands` | Available CLI commands |
| `database_schema` | Table schemas and relationships |
| `database_query` | Execute SQL queries |
| `read_logs` | Application log output |
| `last_error` | Most recent error with stack trace |
| `get_config` | Configuration values |
| `search_docs` | Search framework documentation |
| `tinker` | Interactive REPL for testing |
| `generate_types` | Generate TypeScript types from Rust |

Source: [cancer-mcp](cancer-mcp/src)

## Key Patterns

### Request Handling
Handler functions receive Request, return Response (Result<HttpResponse, HttpResponse>).
Use #[handler] macro for automatic dependency injection.

### Dependency Injection
Use #[service(ConcreteType)] on traits and #[injectable] on implementations.
Services are resolved from the Container automatically.

### Middleware
Global middleware via global_middleware!() in bootstrap.rs.
Route middleware via .middleware() on route definitions.

### Database
SeaORM-based with migrations. Models implement Entity trait.
Use #[derive(Model)] for automatic CRUD operations.

### Validation
Laravel-style validation with rules! macro and Validator struct.
Use #[derive(FormRequest)] for request validation.

### Inertia.js
Full-stack with React/TypeScript. Use Inertia::render() for responses.
Compile-time component validation via macros.
